title: Grayscale CEO's warning: Only two or three spot Bitcoin ETFs are here to stay
description:
The spot Bitcoin ETF fee war will not save the funds from being eventually pulled from the market, Grayscale CEO believes.

Most of the spot Bitcoin (BTC) exchange-traded funds (ETF) approved by the United States Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) won’t survive, Grayscale Investment CEO Michael Sonnenshein says.

 Sonnenshein predicted in an interview with CNBC at the World Economic Forum on Jan. 18 that the majority of the 11 approved spot Bitcoin ETFs are likely to fail.

The U.S. SEC officially approved 11 spot Bitcoin ETFs on Jan. 10, with 10 of them beginning trading the next day. Many ETF issuers were actively lowering their trading fees to raise competitiveness with other ETF sponsors, with most of the approved ETFs setting fees between 0.2% and 0.4%. Multiple spot Bitcoin ETF providers also offered temporary fee waivers.

Read more

title: Blackrock bolsters Bitcoin ETF holdings to surpass $1.2 billion milestone
description:
Quick Take Blackrock has increased its Bitcoin holdings in its Exchange-Traded Fund (ETF) as the fund now retains an impressive count of 28,622 Bitcoin, with an addition of approximately 3,555 Bitcoin. The Blackrock iShares Bitcoin ETF not only made headlines as the inaugural fund to surpass the $1 billion threshold but continued its upward trajectory […]

title: Are altcoins about to recover from recent battering?
description: Altcoins took another hammering on Thursday as heavy selling from the Grayscale Spot Bitcoin ETF forced the $BTC price lower. Many altcoins fared even worse as a result.

title: K33 Research Note Claims Cardano Network Lacks Meaningful Use, Native Token Value at Risk
description: The latest K33 Research note asserts that the Cardano network has no meaningful use and this does not augur well for its native token. title: MetaMask Launches a Validator Staking Service
description:
MetaMask has announced the launch of a new staking service that would allow users to run their validator node for a fee. MetaMask noted that it would run validator nodes on behalf of users who deposit 32 Ethereum tokens. In addition, these users will retain control of their funds and accounts at all times. Let’s […]
